snippet: But the president of the World Bank warned that rising interest rates in emerging markets in response to reports that the United States is preparing to scale back its buying of bonds show that risk remains.
abstract: World Bank president, Jim Yong Kim, says China should hit its gross domestic product growth target of 7.5 percent this year; warns rising interest rates in emerging markets, in response to reports that the United States is preparing to scale back its buying of government bonds, show that significant risk remains.
lead_paragraph: But the president of the World Bank warned that rising interest rates in emerging markets in response to reports that the United States is preparing to scale back its buying of bonds show that risk remains.

headline.main: World Bank Says China Will Reach G.D.P. Target for Year
headline.print_headline:
Nearing End
Of Stimulus
Prompts
A Warning
